note_models.name: Cloze
Image Occlusion Enhanced

tmpls.name: IO Card

fields:
Stratum corneum
{{c1::15-20::how many?}} layers thick, {{c2::flattened::round/flattened}}, {{c3::non-nucleated::nucleated/not nucleated}} keratinized cells.
The dermis is formed of two indistinct layers: the {{c1::papillary}} layer and the {{c2::reticular}} layer

{{c4::Papillary}} layer
•portion just deep to epidermis and basement membrane
•contains dermal papillae
•composed of {{c1::loose::Type}} connective tissue
type {{c2::VII}} collagen fibrils bind {{c3::papillary dermis}} to basal lamina

Reticular layer
•thicker than {{c1::papillary layer}}, less cellular, more fibrous
•formed of dense {{c2::irregular CT}} containing type {{c3::I}} collagen and elastic fibers
•{{c4::hair follicles}} and {{c4::glands}} located in this layer
The {{c4::reticular}} layers contains an extensive {{c1::nerve plexus}} made up of {{c2::sensory}} and {{c2::sympathetic}} fibers (<u>NO </u>{{c3::PARASYMPATHETICS}})

{{c2::Hypodermis}}:
•composed of {{c1::loose connective}} tissue
•binds {{c3::skin}} to underlying organs or tissues
•equivalent to {{c4::superficial fascia}} in gross anatomy
•often contains {{c5::adipose}} cells (panniculus adiposus)
•contains an extensive {{c6::vascular}} network
The epidermis, an epithelium, has no direct {{c1::blood}} supply

The dermis contains two vascular plexuses
•a {{c2::subpapillary}} plexus at the interface of the {{c3::papillary}} and {{c3::reticular}} layers of the dermis
•{{c4::capillary}} loops extend upward into the {{c5::dermal papillae}} from this plexus
•a {{c1::cutaneous}} plexus at the interface between the {{c6::hypodermis}} and the {{c6::reticular}} dermis

Dermal {{c1::vasculature}} is involved with {{c2::thermoregulation}}:
•{{c3::arteriovenous anastomoses}} between the two plexuses shunt blood {{c4::away}} from the papillary dermis to prevent {{c5::heat}} loss when the skin is exposed to cold temperatures
•these shunts can increase blood flow to the {{c6::papillary}} dermis to get rid of excess heat

Sensory nerve endings:
non-encapsulated
{{c2::tactile discs}} accompany {{c1::Merkel’s}} cells
•act as light touch and mechanoreceptors
{{c3::free nerve endings}}
•terminate in both the dermis and epidermis
•respond to pain, temperature, itching and light touch
{{c4::root hair plexuses}}
•surround the base of hair follicles
•detect movements of hairs
